attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings

·       Notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

·       Aggregate bread difference was Excess of 68pcs (White Bread) and 5 Pcs (Brown Bread)

·       Aggregated polybags difference was shortfall of 6pcs.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal item variation implies strong ICS.

value: Minimal variances on stock. This shall be maintained.
Minimal variances. The controls will be strengthened even more.

·       In the prior audit report highlighted variations during physical stock verification on.

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +886 pieces.

ü  White Bread: Variance of +80 pieces.

ü  Brown Bread: Variance (21) Pieces.

ü  Wheat Bran: Variance of (1.05)

Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       From the selected sample of 200g White Bread, 37% of the loaves were found to be underweight.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The Oven Machine should be checked to avoid instances of underweight breads on 200g White Bread.
attributes.effect: Non-compliance with weights and measures regulations exposes the company to potential legal penalties, fines, or sanctions from regulatory authorities.

value:
·        The underweight is a result adjusting extra oven time to avoid large number of under baked breads.

Mackdem Oven Machine is the best.
The oven has a problem and it is affecting the 200g White bread.
In the prior audit, bread underweights were noted in 400g W/BT - 5%, 200g White - 5% and over-weights in 400g W – 15% and 200g – 28%.
Previous
The controls are not effective.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description: ·       The variances noted are as shown in the mixing chart below.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.
attributes.effect:
·       The Average yield was within the set target.

·       54% target achievement indicates that the branch is not meeting its production targets by 46%.

·       Minor variances between Mixing chart and SAP is an indication of good controls.

value: We will work toward achieving the set production target.
The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.

·       Production target was below the set target – 51 bags per day.

Average yield per bag was 196.3.
Previous

Minimal variances between Manual Mixing Chart and SAP. Effective controls.

Set production capacity was not achieved. Controls are not effective.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       It was observed that  production-related damages were within the established limits,  as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality control parameters within the production process to minimize production damages.
attributes.effect: Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

value: To be maintained.
We will maintain strong controls.
In the prior audit, the production damage was 0.5%, while market damages remained within the set limit at 0.2%.

Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Actual production efficiency was 5.1 bags per worker which is slightly above the set limit.

Below is a summary table of the findings

Production efficiency

Implications

·       The company saved KES 5,433 by achieving a higher production efficiency than initially planned (101% of the target). This suggests that the company's operations are becoming more streamlined and cost-effective.
attributes.recommendation: Continue to monitor production efficiency regularly

value: We are working to maintain set target.
The production Efficiency was slightly above KPI.
In the previous audit, the production efficiency was 4.8 bags per production worker, which was slightly below the set efficiency level.
Previous
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Physical cash was verified on 02/04/2024, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

Implications.

Cash loss risk is minimal. This implies strong controls.
attributes.recommendation: Observed cash control is commendable.

value:
·        The cash controls are effective and will be maintained.

Will ensure all production workers adhere to biometric company policies in order to ensure they are paid on time.
The cash held by the cashier is as result of staffs not adhering to biometric.
In the prior audit report, we noted that cash variance of KES +61.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·    An analysis of the debt balance as of 2 April 2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       During the audit, it was noted that there were no balances.

Implication

No significant issues were identified in the debtor balances.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The sales and operations teams should continue maintaining effective controls over debtors.

value: ·       To be maintained.
We will maintain debtor’s controls.
In the prior audit, no significant outstanding balances were noted.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Finding.

·       Spot checks were done on the branch minishops to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

·       On the spot-check days, no issue of non-compliance was noted in the visited minishops (Akiyda, Mazeras and Miritini).

I         Implication           

Minishop SOPs are being observed.
attributes.recommendation: Minishops SOPs to continue being observed.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
To be maintained.
It was observed that there was a discrepancy of -29 pieces of bread of 200g WB. (Akiyda Minishop)

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done to assess compliance to company policies.

On 3 April 2025, it was noted that the Manager was not the one fueling the vehicle.
attributes.recommendation: Manager should be responsible for fueling the vehicle in order to monitor fuel efficiency effectively.
attributes.remediation_plan: Analyze fuel consumption per trip or delivery route and compare with standard.

value: This is noted.
I will be fueling the vehicle effective 5th April.
No previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

·       Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 20l/hr.

·       Generator fuel consumption from 10/03/2025 – 01/04/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

Implication

The generator consumption was within the set standards. The 13.18 liters per hour is lower than the expected rate, it indicates fuel savings.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Economical fuel consumption by the generator is commendable.

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
The generator has not run for long in the month of March.
·       No previous audit findings.
